item.title: Attack animation
item.dc:creator: @DemonWars DemonWars
item.description:
@DemonWars wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Read what I said.

what he said explained is (not sure if its the same at 317)
an argument is equal to the person or object/item that the variable is sent too,
easy explained:

int = the actor its being sent to (this may be a item, NPC, object, or player)

you have various Variables and voids to start a argument with

like:
Int
Void
Boolean (or how u spell it correctly)
and some more what i don’t recall at the moment.

EDIT: the start of a argument is before the getAttackEmote();
between the () it may wanna say (p, 2522) idk what the 317 use

Greetz DemonWars

Read full topic

item.title: Attack animation
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:11, topic:422865”][quote author=zzjimmy link=topic=525517.msg3827364#msg3827364 date=1322284166]

getAttackEmote();

Tell that method you are using on your transformation ring to grab the animation from static int getAttackEmote in the npchandler class

I kind of understood but, how will i show the Id of the attack emote?

317 or 508?

317 (delta)
[/quote]
Well if your using delta, it might be a different method, however, heres how it works:
if you state the npc id, and you declare, lets say in this case, getattackemote, it will grab the attack emote set for that NPC id that was put in the getattackemote method[/quote]
Ah, so that’s how it works. I think I just need to find the correct variable or make a switch statement because that method isn’t working for me.

DemonWars:

damn if it was 508 i could spoonfeed you everything XD

aha yea thanks anyways [quote=“AtomicInt_, post:13, topic:422865”]@Drub, there’s a argument in that you can’t simply just put [tt]getAttackEmote();[/tt]

You’d have to add the argument inside the parenthesis I.E: [tt]getAttackEmote(argument);[/tt][/quote]
what’s an argument?

Read full topic

You’d have to add the argument inside the parenthesis I.E: [tt]getAttackEmote(argument);[/tt][/quote]

item.title: Attack animation
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“zzjimmy, post:10, topic:422865”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=525517.msg3826730#msg3826730 date=1322253118]

getAttackEmote();

Tell that method you are using on your transformation ring to grab the animation from static int getAttackEmote in the npchandler class
[/quote]

I kind of understood but, how will i show the Id of the attack emote?

317 or 508?

317 (delta)[/quote]
Well if your using delta, it might be a different method, however, heres how it works:
if you state the npc id, and you declare, lets say in this case, getattackemote, it will grab the attack emote set for that NPC id that was put in the getattackemote method

item.title: Attack animation
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

so I am trying to create a specific attack animation that you make when you put on a transformation ring. I need to know how to write the code. Here’s what I put in:

if(wearID == 4202) { npcId = 82; npcId2 = 82; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; attackanim == 64;

i got an error because "“attackanim” isn’t the proper code. Does anybody know what the proper code is?

Read full topic
